Dear Holly Halabicky:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Rorie Dodge-Pifer, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
This report contains sexually implicit content.
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI250410439
Licensee Group Organization: Prism Project
Licensee Designee: Sylvia Blythe
Chief Administrator: Holly Halabicky
Agency Name: Mission Ranch
Agency Address: 9300 Lahring Road
Gaines, MI 48436
License Status: Original
License Expiration Date: 06/11/2023
Capacity: 6
II. METHODOLOGY

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health
Description service policies and procedures addressing all of the
following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and
behavioral health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth self-harmed and requested to see a doctor and the agency
did not comply. Youth did not see a therapist for 1 week following
the incident. The same youth went AWOL and was sexually
assaulted and requested to see a doctor and the facility did not
comply.
Investigation Interviews:
The complainant was contacted on 5/3/23. She stated she did not
have any additional information as the information she did have
came from the facility’s assign consultant. A phone call was
placed to the assigned consultant. She stated she thought Youth
A was just trying to get out of the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/4/23.
Youth A reported she ran away a month ago with another youth.
The youth made it to Grand Rapids where the other youth knew
people. She said the youth were gone for 24 hours. Youth A said
she was sexually assaulted and that is when she called the police.
Youth A initially told the police she did not want to go to the
hospital but when she returned to the facility around 2am she
asked to go. The "admin team" told her she could not go. A week
later Youth A hurt herself and they would not take her to the
hospital. She used a piece of glass to scratch her arm. Youth A
showed her arm and she did not have any scars or scabs on her
arm. She said the wounds healed. She said the wounds were
really bad. Youth A said she was really bleeding and told Staff 1
she needed to go to the hospital. Staff 1 told her she could not go
to the hospital. Youth A then went back into the bathroom and
continued to hurt herself. Youth A said she meets with her
therapist once a week and has group therapy twice a week. Youth
A said a suicide screening was not completed the night she hurt
herself. Her safety plan was updated to say if she hurts herself,
she will lose privileges. The plan also says she cannot have any
sharps or markers and has limited TV time. Youth A said she has
been removed from the safety plan.
The Licensee Designee (LD) and Social Service Supervisor (SSS)
were interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/4/23. LD stated
she is the executive director and the nurse for the facility. She is
2

also a Sexual Assault Nurse Examiner (SANE). She said Youth A
has wanted to leave the facility since first arriving and will do
things to go to the hospital. Every time Youth A harms herself or
threatens to harm herself she receives a virtual screening through
Genesee Health System (GHS) which is the local Community
Mental Health Authority. A safety plan was also implemented for
Youth A and she saw the psychiatrist on 4/4/23. Her last self-harm
screening occurred on 5/1/23 after Youth A told her Guardian Ad
Litem she wanted to hurt herself. LD has asked GHS for
documentation of the screenings Youth A has had but they have
been unresponsive. LD said when she was picked up by the
police after being AWOL Youth A refused to get an exam saying
the sexual assault happened over her clothes. Once back at the
facility it was discovered Youth A had hidden a vape in her private
area. LD stated Youth A did not need a medical exam if there was
no penetration. The staff are made aware of changes to policy and
safety plans through group text and a staff logbook that is
reviewed each shift.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A Case File: Physical Exam. Youth A had a physical
on 3/10/23.
• Nursing note from 3/11/23 Youth A expressed suicidal
thoughts, but no plan. Staff reassured her that they are
there to help her. Later Youth A requested to go to a mental
hospital. She was again reassured that they could provide
what she needed at the facility.
• Nursing note from 3/12/23 Youth A was having thoughts of
suicide but did not have a plan. When LD talked to Youth A
she said she just wanted to go to the hospital. LD assured
her that staff were there to help her, and they would do
everything the hospital would do. Later Youth A broke a
make-up case and took a plastic piece into the bathroom to
scratch herself. LD came into the facility to evaluate Youth
A. Multiple superficial scratches on her left arm. No blood
was noted. She was put on one-on-one supervision with no
access to sharp objects and cleared to remain at the
facility.
• 3/12/23 Incident Report Youth A went to the bathroom and
when she came out she showed staff scratches on her arm
saying she tried to self-harm. Objects were removed and
staff distracted Youth A from her thoughts. One-on-One
supervision for 24 hours.
• 3/13/23 Incident report. Youth A requested to go to the
hospital as she tried to hurt herself. Youth A asked staff
"what do I need to do to myself to get out of here?" Harmful
3

objects removed and wounds treated. Youth A was
provided with one-on-one supervision and the bathroom
door needed to be cracked open when she uses it.
• 3/20/23 Incident Report. Youth A and a peer went AWOL
while staff went downstairs to get a coloring book. The
youth were seen on camera leaving the house with
backpacks. Police were called.
• E-mail to LD stating the youth had been found in Grand
Rapids on 3/21/23. LD went with an advocate to pick the
youth up and brought them back to the facility.
• Nursing note from 3/23/23 Youth A had a drug screen after
returning from AWOL. Screen was positive for THC.
• Youth A safety plan dated 3/22/23 includes direct
supervision of Youth A, and Youth A's schedule. The plan
was later revised to include safety checks of Youth A's
bedroom and bathroom.
• Nursing note from 3/25/23 another youth reported Youth A
had a vape. LD searched Youth A's person and bathroom
but did not find the vape. On 3/26/23 Youth A turned the
vape over to staff. Youth A stated she had it hidden in her
underwear.
• Nursing note from 3/27/23 Youth A had requested a
medical exam for vaginal discharge, but stated she was
fine now. There was no more vaginal discharge. LD talked
to her about not inserting objects into her vagina. Youth A
said she did not insert it but put it under her pad.
• 4/1/23 Incident Report. Youth A was found with glass in her
pocket.
• Nursing note from 4/1/23 completed by LD. Wounds on left
arm appear superficial, non-bleeding, and straight lines.
Consistent with using a sharp object not fingernails. Youth
A admitted to using a piece of glass. All glass removed.
• 4/2/23 Incident Report. Youth A had used her fingernails to
scratch her arms. She said she wanted to go to the
hospital. She then locked herself in the bathroom. Once out
of the bathroom her wounds were cleaned.
• Psychiatric Evaluation dated 4/4/23. Signs and symptoms
of depression. Medication changes made.
• Self-Harm Policy: Staff are to call the therapist so a safety
assessment can be completed and call the Nurse or
Medical Director for evaluation of injuries.
• Suicide Ideation Policy: Staff are to call the on-call clinical
staff. The on-call staff member will assess the situation and
determine the next step by completing a suicide
assessment then make a decision to move forward with the
need for further evaluation and transport to hospital.
4

• Youth A Case File: Youth A was admitted to the program
on 3/9/23. She has a history of stealing, lying, self-harm,
suicidal ideation, and sexual exploitation.
• LD’s license was verified by Licensing and Regulatory
Affairs. She is a Registered nurse and licensed until 2025.
She also provided her SANE certification which is valid until
12/31/23.
• Genesee Health System (GHS) Progress Notes and Crisis
Screenings: Youth A met with staff from GHS due to self-
harm and/or suicidal ideation on 3/15/23, 3/30/23, 5/1/23,
5/5/23, and 5/10/23. All documentation indicated Youth A
did not need to be hospitalized and she was to continue
receiving treatment at the facility.
Analysis Based on documentation and LD's interview Youth A did not
require a visit to the hospital as Youth A did not report penetration
from the sexual assault and she was being screened for suicidal
ideation and found not to require hospitalization.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
6/1/23
